alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Wyandot (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 10:12AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Wyandot and Hancock Counties through 1045 AM EDT... At 1011 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rawson to near Chippewa Park. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Findlay, Bluffton, Forest, Arlington, Rawson, Vanlue, Carey, Mount Blanchard, Wharton, Benton Ridge, Jenera, Mount Cory, Kirby and Williamstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for northwestern Ohio.
